edu.rit.crst

Class Function

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.rit.crst.Computation
      • edu.rit.crst.Function
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AESBase, SHA1, SHA256Base, SHA3Base, SHA512Base, SHAKE128, SHAKE256

    public abstract class Function
extends Computation
    Class Function is the abstract base class for a cryptographic function. A cryptographic function has two inputs A and B and one output C, each of which is a BigInt.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Function()
      Construct a new cryptographic function object.

      • constructor

        public abstract java.lang.String constructor()
        Get a constructor expression for this cryptographic function. The constructor expression can be passed to the edu.rit.util.Instance.newInstance() method to construct an object that is the same as this cryptographic function.
        Returns:
        Constructor expression.

      • evaluate

        public abstract void evaluate(BigInt A,
            BigInt B,
            BigInt[] C)
        Evaluate this cryptographic function. The function is evaluated on inputs A and B, and the output of each round is stored in the C array.

        Note: The evaluate() method is performed on the CPU in a single thread. It is intended as a cross-check for the GPU kernel.

        Parameters:
        A - Input A.
        B - Input B.
        C - Array of outputs C, indexed by round.

      • functionKernel

        public FunctionKernel functionKernel(Gpu gpu)
                              throws java.io.IOException
        Get the GPU kernel for this cryptographic function.
        Parameters:
        gpu - GPU accelerator.
        Returns:
        Kernel.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown if an I/O error occurred.
        GpuException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if a GPU error occurred.
